Politics Title: The GOP is now the party of big business 
 Text: I know that this may sound like a contradiction but it really isn't. It used to be that Republicans were for small government and free markets. Now they are against both those things. They have become the party of big business. This has been going on since Reagan was elected in 1980. Since then we have seen deregulation after deregulation, tax cuts for corporations at the expense of working people, massive corporate welfare programs, etc. All these things have led to an economy where only the rich can afford to buy houses or cars while everyone else struggles. We also see more people living paycheck to paycheck. In other words, our country is becoming less fair as time goes on. And yet there seems to be no end to it. If you look

Politics Title: The GOP's War on Women 
 Text: I was reading an article about how women are being discriminated against in the workplace and that they should be paid less than men. This is a very common thing for people to say when it comes to women. They claim that men have more money because of their work ethic, but if you look at what most women do with this money, it's not nearly as much money. Most women spend all or part of it on food (food, gas, groceries, etc) which means they don't buy things like new clothes or shoes often. If you're going to complain about this, then why aren't there any laws preventing employers from paying women less? Why isn't anyone talking about this? It's just so blatantly obvious that these companies need to pay women less. It seems like

Politics Title: The GOP's War on Women 
 Text: I don't know if this is a thing that has been said before, but it seems to be the case in every election cycle. Every time there are women running for office, they get attacked by Republicans and their supporters. They have no choice but to run as "pro-life" or "anti-choice" because of this. It just doesn't seem fair. If you want to talk about how unfair things are, then look at what happened with Sarah Palin when she was running. She had to go through all these attacks from both sides before being able to win her election. It's not fair to say that she's going to lose because of it. I'm sure some people will disagree with me here, but that's my opinion.

Politics Title: The GOP is trying to make it harder for people with pre-existing conditions 
 Text: I am a single mother of 2 kids and my husband has cancer. We have been paying out of pocket for his insurance since we were married in 2008. He was diagnosed with cancer when he was 19 years old. Since then our health care costs have skyrocketed from $2000 per month to over $10,000 per month. Our premiums are now double what they used to be. My husband's medical bills alone cost us about $20,000. And that doesn't include the fact that we had to move into an apartment because we couldn't afford rent anymore. So even though I'm not eligible for any government assistance or subsidies like Obamacare, I still can't get affordable insurance. What can be done so that this won't happen again?

Politics Title: The GOP is trying to make it harder for people with pre-existing conditions 
 Text: I know this has been discussed a lot in the past but I'm not sure if it's really that big of an issue or not. If you have health insurance and are sick enough to be on your own then you're covered by it. But what about those who don't get insurance? What happens when they need medical care because they're uninsured? How do we fix that? And how does everyone else feel about it?

 Text: I was just reading about this [article](here). It says that they are collecting information from all of us and storing it in a database so when we go online or use our phones for anything else then their computers can see what we're doing. They have already done this with your credit card information. This isn't even something new. It's been going on since at least 2001. Why do you think there were no laws against this? Because people didn't care. If you're not doing anything wrong why would anyone care? You don't need to be spying on everyone because if someone does something bad enough they'll get caught. We should only care about things like terrorism where it's obvious who did it. But that's another story.

Science Title: The first ever image of a black hole 
 Text: [Image](imgur.com/XQFmq.jpg) 
 
 I was looking at the Hubble Space Telescope and saw this image. It is very clear to see that there are two holes in the center of the galaxy. One has been filled with matter from outside while another one is still empty. This means that if you were inside the galaxy it would be completely dark except for these holes. If we could get an image like this, then we can understand what happens when something falls into a black hole.

Science Title: The first ever image of a black hole in action 
 Text: [Here is the image](imgur.com/wx4z.jpg) taken by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope on April 1, 2012. This was one of the most amazing images I have seen so far and it shows how fast these things can move. It also gives us an idea of what happens inside them. 
 
 As you can see from this image, there are two jets shooting out at different angles as they pass through each other. One jet shoots straight up while the other shoots down towards Earth. These jets appear to be rotating very quickly but we don't know exactly why. They may just be moving faster than light or something else. We will probably never find out.

Science Title: The first direct evidence of the existence of a supermassive black hole in our own Milky Way galaxy has been found. 
 Text: [Image](source) 
 
 A team led by astronomers at UC Santa Cruz and Caltech have found that there is an extremely large object orbiting around Sagittarius A*. This object, which they call Sgr A*, was discovered using NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory as part of its ongoing survey of nearby galaxies. It appears to be about 10 billion times larger than Earth, but it may not actually exist - it's too far away from us for that. However, this discovery could help scientists understand how galaxies evolve over time.

Science Title: The first ever image of a black hole in the center of our galaxy 
 Text: [Image](imgur.com/jpqkL) 
 
 This is what I was looking for when searching for images of quasars and such. It shows that there are two types of black holes, one at each end of the galaxy. One type has a lot more mass than the other type, but they both have to be very massive before it can form an accretion disk. A quasar would not do this because its matter is so much lighter than ours. 
 
 So if we could see these things with telescopes then we might find out how big they are. But until then, I'm just happy that someone found them. 
 
 EDIT: Thanks everyone who commented. I'll check them out.

The liveweb proxy captures the content of a web page in real time, archives it into a ARC or WARC file and returns the ARC/WARC record back to the wayback machine to process.  The Internet Archive discovers and captures web pages through many different web crawls.
